Message.Msg: The fees on more expensive items have not just doubled, they have more than tripled. Ebay customer service is telling those who complain to use other internet sights and they will even recommend alternative sites to the sellers. A powerseller customer service representative told me that ebays only concern is Amazon. That is it. Ebay wants Amazons sellers to switch to ebay, and ebay does not care at all if it loses all of its current sellers as long as it gets Amazons sellers. I sell mostly in the collectibles category. The representative stated that ebay no longer wants to be considered a flea market and does not want used items sold on the site any more. That is why they are trying to force sellers of used items off of ebay. I cant understand how this can be good for profits. Why not keep all of the sellers and get money from everyone. ebay management doesn't care though and just wants to transform ebay into Amazon at all costs.
":they will loose many others" It's supposed to be LOSE, not LOOSE. Sully
Eactly who is beneftiing (other than Ebay), the buyer or seller, now that Ebay has raised the Buy It Now percent on auction-style listings from 10% to 30%

Message.Title: Is Ebay the next Netflix from $52 to over $200 in 9 months?
Message.Msg: Netflix is only making $.30 & Ebay over $2.
All eBay customer service is outsourced to Asia reps as of 2012, regardless of TRS or Powerseller status.

"does not want used items sold on the site any more. That is why they are trying to force sellers of used items off of ebay." That isn't true in fact it's an outright LIE If Ebay wanted used items off the site they would eliminate the used tab when choosing new or used. . .

Message.Title: Based on Amzn & Netflix, Ebay should be at $100: Ebay is profitable & front runner in mobile
Message.Msg: PayPal reves should double by next year imo.

I did not say that they are not allowing used items. I said that they are actively pushing sellers of used items off of ebay by raising fees and recommending that they try other sites like etsy. There is a difference.
Why would you place 50 calls to ebay customer service? That seems a little extreme, doesn't it.

I've talked with Ebay CS several times over the past month I sell only USED items They never mentioned that to me In fact Ebay thanked me for being such a good long time seller I HIGHLY doubt Ebay is trying to rid the site of sellers of used items ~ LOL
50 calls over a 5 year period isn't that many I like talking to Ebay reps since they help me pay my bills ~ LOL
That's not even close to being true I know because I always ask Most of the reps have an american accent (caucasian)
You're delusional. eBay no longer has customer service reps in Utah. My sister-in-law used to work at the Utah call center but it has been shut down since 2012, so stop talking your nonsense.
Obviously he's psychotic.

Message.Title: Fair Marketplace bill, not applied to ebay???
Message.Msg: "The law would only apply to online sellers that have sales of at least $1 million in states where they don't have physical operations, like a store or a warehouse." Is this bill applied to Ebay directly or Ebay sellers only? Even if this is applied to Ebay sellrers, not Ebay, There are many big Ebay sellers of multi million revenue. This will bring down Ebay fee income. Ebay charge relatively high fees, so I guess this will be a big damage to Ebay either way.

Message.Title: No Justice Is Served Until Ebay Is Homeless Too
Message.Msg: Slowly happening as we speak! The ebay site has lost customers, credibility, items for sale, and is filling up with fakes and scams. In just a few short years ebay has turned positivity and a decent economy for sellers into massive negativity and disappearing sellers. Ebay stock holders think they're making money but they're buying hot air and failed promises. Ebay is being roasted to extinction. The little fago board trolls here help that campaign too, in their own fago way.
